utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Book you for 9:00?

utterance.speaker: Taxi Driver
utterance.content: Yeah. Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Take the day off.

utterance.speaker: Taxi Driver
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what did you do?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You figured out I was in jail but you don’t know why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’ve been busy.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Excessive prescribing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not that busy. I know that you pled down to excessive prescribing. The question was “what did you DO?”

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: 36-year-old non-smoking junior high science teacher started coughing blood in the middle of homeroom.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sweet! If I go straight to the airport, I can make Cabo for the last call.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He also said to call him if we find a case.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Which we didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What do you call this?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He’s coughing blood.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: A lot of people are. Right now I have to get to Vernon while there is still enough powder to ski on.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Make it fast. I'm driving. I don't want to end up in jail like…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: … A person should who used their phone illegally while driving.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: 36-year-old male with hemoptysis, headaches, chills, and chest pain.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Where are you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: On my way to the greater Schenectady chili cook-off and spud gun competition.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's your honeymoon?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope, Dominika went to A.C. with her boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: E.R. ruled out bronchitis, pneumonia, and lung cancer.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So diagnosis… boring. It's epistaxis. It's a nosebleed. Blood runs into his lungs, he coughs it back up, flu explains the rest of the symptoms.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Going once, going twice…

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Toxic exposure to ammonia or sulfites can traumatize the lungs, cause neuralgias or fevers. Fits better because of his radiating chest pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sold. To Masters. Do a home search for toxins. Draw cultures for bacteria and fungi.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're married?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were gone so long. Green card.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Thanks for not saying anything. I just need some time to…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I didn't do it for you. Some puzzles are just too good to share.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: This is my exit.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Chili?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I hate chili. Love spud guns.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You get nosebleeds?

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. You think that's where the blood came from?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't just think it. I hope it.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: When was the last time it happened?

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: At the quarterfinals. I coach volleyball, and during warm-ups, I got hit in the nose a few months ago.

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: With showers?

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Clean showers?

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: Not particularly.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The blood you were coughing up wasn't blood. Dirty gym washroom means serratia infection. Your lungs are full of red bacteria. You were right. That was an interesting case. You start him on Levaquin. I'll start looking for my good flip-flops.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Think that might be blood.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What's this really all about, House? As convincing as I find your deep devotion to vegetable trajectory.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: First of all, it's a tuber. And you're just jealous because your potato-related plans are more of the serving up fries variety. You did time. Means your license is suspended. Which means your leave of absence is definitely indefinite. What exactly are you going back to?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'd only have to serve up fries until the medical board hearing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I stand corrected. You obviously have a rich, full life waiting for you. I'll slow down the car and you can roll out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Damn. If only I'd planned for that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay. Here’s what I’ve got. One: you were in jail for 6 months but you were gone about a year, which means that when you left, you hadn’t been arrested. Two: you enjoy being known as a number, you don’t want people to know the real you since the real you is weak. You were running a bleeding heart medical consulting business for illegals or some other sympathetic under-class.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Over-class?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The interrogation thing is getting annoying.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Studies have shown that un-annoying interrogation is 50 percent less effective.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wilson thinks it’s stupid.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I think it’s stupid!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Junior year high school, you placed fourth in the West Virginia all-county science fair. Your project? Clean combustion.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yeah. I also wore a training bra. Things have changed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I've been going to this contest for four years. For four years I've come second to a pissant named Harold Lam.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: This is serious?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Second!

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Okay. I can help you, but I'm going to need to make a personal stop along the way.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What kind of stop?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Personal. Did I not mention that?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You gonna tell me where you were last night?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I ran into a friend.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We had 50 bucks on the Bulls. I had to eat a large pizza by myself.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You missed me.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not as much as I miss my $50. Where'd you meet her?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: At the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If it's Masters, just lie to me.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The redhead. She's hot.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And I'm seeing her again tomorrow night.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don't know how you do it. Is it the cute, harmless vibe, the self-deprecating humor, or just straight-up roofies?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If you're interested, I do seminars.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No electric, no gas either. It's cold in here.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The good thing is I found a guy who makes you look like a good roommate.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Maybe hoarding's a symptom. Could be caused by brain injury or early-onset Alzheimer's.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's most likely that it's psychological. As to what's making him cough blood, dealer's choice.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How does this guy live, let alone make it to work every day and teach a bunch of kids?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'll be in the car.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Okay, turn right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were writing bogus prescriptions for medical marijuana. Please say no because you have to be an idiot to actually screw that up.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No. I mean, I was, but I didn't get caught.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have to admit, you have one of the best game faces I've ever seen. Also one of the best game bodies.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Pull over.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Didn't know you were a Jehovah's Witness.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're really not gonna tell me what just happened?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I don't know about you, but I am starving.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We slowly pushed into your home.

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: So what did you find?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: A compost heap in your fridge. We think you have aspergillosis. It's treatable with antifungals.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You do remarkably well for living… like you live.

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: I use bottled water and flashlights. It's like camping.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Fun. We're also gonna need a psych consult.

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: I'm not a hoarder. I'm just a major slob.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You save earwax.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You know, I'm actually kind of hurt that you don't know what I did. I'm not worth bribing a court official or hacking into police records?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where's the fun in that?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don't know?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What, is he dead or something?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're gonna have to do a lot better than that. Are… are you okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm fine. It's not a big deal.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I killed a man.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Psych eval gave us nothing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So our patient is just an average Joe with a two-foot pile of used q-tips?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Whatever he is, he doesn't have aspergillosis. Pain's intensified, and now he needs oxygen.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There's got to be all kinds of toxins in that place.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Exposure issues don't make sense. He's been here a full day. He'd be getting better, not worse.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Unless exposure was keeping him from getting worse. The gas was off at his place. How does he stay warm?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Portable heater?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Or portable gas heater, which emits carbon monoxide.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Which is a vasodilator. The low-grade exposure was actually improving his lung capacity. We bring him here, he gets worse. If we're right, don't need House, and we still get two days off.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We still have to prove it. Someone's got to go back into that place and test for C.O.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Chase and I can go. It's only fair.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Fairness is important.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're awfully quiet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry. That's just how I get around people who have recently killed a man.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It wasn't… You know, I've had a pretty rough year. Do you think maybe we could just give this whole thing a rest?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You killed a man! But you pled out to drugs. Hit-and-run under the influence. Guy you kneed in the groin was your date who dropped a dime on you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm asking you to let it go.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Ruby, right?

utterance.speaker: Ruby
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hey, how are you liking PPTH?

utterance.speaker: Ruby
utterance.content: It's great. Everyone's so friendly.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah. Especially Dr. Taub. Don't worry. I'm not gonna bust your chops. I just want to know one thing. How did he get you to go out with him?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, he's… he's great. I'm… you know, I'm just asking because… Well, he's… um…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You know what, never mind. It's none of my business. You guys have fun tonight.

utterance.speaker: Ruby
utterance.content: I'm not seeing him tonight. We had plans, but he canceled.

utterance.speaker: Woman on PA
utterance.content: Dr. Stern to Radiology. Dr. Stern to Radiology.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: This thing's got no fuel valve. Means you can't regulate the input. And what is this? A barbecue lighter? Your gun sucks.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You like it here.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You don't think this is fascinating?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not nearly as fascinating as the fact that you think it's fascinating.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: But this guy kept everything he ever came into contact with. An interactive life history.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's an indiscriminate pile of rubbish.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Well, for the most part, so are our lives.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Maybe we don't just figure out the what, we figure out the why. Then maybe…

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: If you're thinking Q fever, it fits.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So why are you still looking?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Well, you only found one thing.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It fits perfectly.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Yeah, but that doesn't mean…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You missed something at his place. His wife.

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: Nina.

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: I didn't know where you were.

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: I'm so sorry. I couldn't get home. You okay?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We think you both have Q fever. Found raccoon feces in the kitchen cupboard. We're gonna start you on Doxycycline.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Why wouldn't you tell us you're married?

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: The fewer people who know about her, the easier it is.

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: When can I go back?

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: She gets anxious when she's away from her things.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: She's the hoarder. He just lives there.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: On purpose?

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: She's my wife.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: By the way, Harold's probably gonna hit on you. Everything I have, he wants. Just turn him down flat. Unless…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not sugges… Would you do that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hang time, distance, and accuracy. Okay, how about this? You met a guy in a club, you brought him home, he O.D.'d, so the guy now writhing on his front porch was the dealer who sold you the faulty goods.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Categories weighted the same?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yup.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Screw accuracy. We're gonna double distance and hang time, beat Harold on points. We need raw power. Where's the fertilizer?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: By all means, Kaczynski.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hi. You and Taub sharing phones now?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's seeing the redhead on the third floor.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Please tell me you're not talking about the hot new CNA with the dimples.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She confirmed it. What she didn't confirm was their date tonight. He bailed on her.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If he's standing her up, he must have something better going on.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Better than sex with a 22-year-old? Who's RT92?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Presumably a 21-year-old.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Whoever it is, Taub's meeting 'em at my place at 8:00, which is usually when I go to the gym.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Guess you'll be missing spin class.

utterance.speaker: Man on PA
utterance.content: Okay, contestants, the field is now open for practice. You've got one hour. Have fun.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Schedule 80 PVC is pressure rated for 220 psi, fuel valve 300. We can easily push it to 250, have your friend Harold peeing in his pants.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Be cool.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Harold.

utterance.speaker: Harold
utterance.content: House. You look good. I like that jacket on you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thanks. You filled out a little.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's the boot in your ass. Perhaps you've heard of famed Russian physicist Olga Petrovich?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And her granddaughter works at a little place called JPL.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She killed a man.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Just a bad combustion valve.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: On my sofa.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hey… RT92.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I hope you like rhubarb.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We're celebrating. We're going rogue.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We rip out the combustion valve, replace it with disks. With enough pressure, it should blow out at maximum velocity.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Turning the spud into spudnik. What do we use for disks?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Well, here's a hint. I actually hate rhubarb.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That line always works for you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what did you do?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No more guessing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Damn. I could have saved myself a job offer.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We both acted like idiots. And I ended up doing time. Guess he did more.

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: When we first moved into the house, we had people over all the time. Then she started collecting things. I figured it was a hobby. Piles turned into art projects, and art projects turned into what you saw.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: So why do you stay?

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: To everyone else, the world is full of junk… meaningless, ugly, broken things. But to Nina, every shape, every color, texture, smell, they all tell a story. They're all worth treasuring. I wouldn't wish what she has on anyone, but every now and then I get a glimpse of what she sees, and… It helps.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Your lungs are clearing up nicely. Respiratory rate's normal. Temp's normal. Looks like you're gonna be fine.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Something's wrong with her heart.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The husband is fine. The wife is worse. She had a heart attack.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Her heart attack could be from a complication.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Q fever would cause congestive heart failure, not myocardial infarction.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So she had Q fever and something else that causes heart attack?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And the hoarding. Now that the wife is the only patient, hoard is back on the board.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Or we were wrong about Q fever. I don't buy it's just a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not a coincidence. Diagnosis X caused the hoarding, which caused the Q fever when the raccoons came to spend spring break at her house. Now all we have to do is solve for X.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I remember somebody saying that hoarding could be a symptom. We should do an MRI. Hydrogen sulfide. It's given off by eggs and rotting food. Long-term exposure could cause the pulmonary issues, headaches…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Even the heart attack. Hydrogen sulfide is also a vasodilator.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which my crack team never tested the place for. Of course, half my crack team never tested the place for people.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: So we should go back, check it out.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Might be safer to just assume we're right and start treatment.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go with God. And some air freshener.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You know, maybe Taub is right, so I'm gonna stay here with him and help him with the MRI.`

utterance.speaker: Man on PA
utterance.content: Shine up your spuds, folks. We're gonna start shooting for hang time in just a few minutes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The wind's coming from the southeast. You have to aim five degrees to the left.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We're gonna break 14 seconds. I can feel it. When I was 10 or 11, my dad used to take us to this county fair. And there was this kid… What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who's "us"?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: My mom and me.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Not everything means something. We're gonna be up soon. I want to check the pressure. She picks up the gun and walks away.]

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don't wake up in the middle of the night to cry over a dead stranger. You don't confess to killing a man and then hide the details unless the details reveal more about you than the crime itself. You pled down to drugs. You've got a horrible genetic disease and a sibling who's suddenly on your mind.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You euthanized your brother. And that guy back at the house was the doctor who wouldn't help you cover it up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But I was right about everything else.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're mad.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No. Actually, I'm impressed. Messing around on a 22-year-old hottie with your wife on my sofa. You're a full-throttle head case.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I was doing you a solid with the sofa. Rachel wanted to do it in your bed. You've got the memory foam top.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Let's make this really simple: If I own it, I don't want you doing it on it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You might want to get rid of your kitchen table. Look, I'm sorry, but it was worth it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah, I bet. You get to mess with her physically and emotionally.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I still care about her.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not enough to let her move on with her life. While we're talking about your bad ideas, MRI's clean.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: There has to be some kind of inciting psychological incident.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: This is perfect for you. You get all the human interaction you crave without any actual human interaction.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You know when you're interested in something and nobody else is, the polite thing is to keep it to yourself.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Popular, beautiful, gregarious.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hydrogen sulfide's about two parts per billion. The size of a healthy fart. I'll be back for you in July.

utterance.speaker: Harold
utterance.content: Dumped in a field in Schenectady. Ouch. You mind if I make a move? I know she's out of my league, but she's at a spud gun contest with the soon-to-be five-time runner-up, so she's probably got some self-esteem issues.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Warning.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, it turns out our friend Harold felt up the sheriff's daughter last night at the potato mash mixer, so sheriff's feeling kind of ambivalent.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You always get your way, don't you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not always. Today would have been our one-year anniversary. Which is an incredibly arbitrary thing to celebrate.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: If you want to get to the bottom of something, you literally have to dig down to the bottom. So stratigraphically, the oldest stuff I found was in the bedroom. And the oldest stuff in the bedroom was in the closet. And at the bottom of the closet… Tell me about this.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We have a new symptom. Infertility. They wanted kids but couldn't have them. She started collecting things to fill the void. We should run a full hormone blood panel.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, Harriet the Spy, before you get too full of yourself, you might want to go back to bio 101. It takes two to not-tango.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Hubby could be shooting blanks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So either it's a new symptom that will help us save her life or it's a complete waste of time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Figure out which is fried, the bacon or the eggs.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I'll start the hormone workup.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: There's another option.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Radio.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sounded a lot like… Thirteen.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's a Thirteen tribute band with their new song, "I've got a better theory than Masters."

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: She said they never had kids.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Where the hell have you been?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No, we don't. She's been missing for a year.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You can ask her all about it when she comes in on Monday.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Can I talk? She said they never had kids, and you all jumped to infertility. You never considered the other option.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And the bitch is back.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We think you have Ehlers-Danlos syndrome. It would explain the symptoms. It also causes miscarriages. Is that something you think you might have?

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: Were you pregnant?

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: Three times.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: The miscarriages triggered the hoarding. Hoarding eventually made you sick too.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We can treat the physical symptoms as they arise, make her life a lot better, but the hoarding, we're the wrong kind of doctors.

utterance.speaker: Brian
utterance.content: What have I ever done to make you afraid of that? I need to get some air.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I've been selfish. I need to let you move on. I think we should stop seeing each other.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Um, I just want you to be able to…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: The last time you got all noble on me, we ended up dividing our dishes. This time, I want to make the decision.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You don't feel weird about this?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Of course I feel weird about this. It's confusing and messy and dirty. Dumb. But we spent our whole lives trying to do everything right, and it sucked.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It wasn't all bad.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It sucked, Chris. And this, whatever it is, it's fun.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So I'm not taking advantage of you?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: The fun is fading.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You know… there's something seriously wrong with us.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Home, sweet home.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You owe me 87 bucks for gas.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll kill you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: When the time comes, if you want me to.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll do it now if you like. I think I've got a baseball bat in the back.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'll see you Monday.
